Shabriri Grape.name: Shabriri Grape
Shabriri Grape.summary: Yellowing, oozing eyeball of the infirm
description: A yellowing, oozing eyeball of the infirm. The surface is shriveled, and the inside is squishy, not unlike a large, overly-ripe grape.
Give to the blind maiden to guide her to the distant light.

Deathroot.name: Deathroot
Deathroot.summary: Beast Clergyman seeks and devours these
description: A source that gives rise to Those Who Live in Death.
The Beast Clergyman, found at Bestial Sanctum in the distant east, collects and devours these roots.

On the night of the dire plot the stolen Rune of Death enabled the first Death of a demigod. Later, the Rune of Death spread across the Lands Between through the underground roots of the Greattree, sprouting in the form of Deathroot.

Celestial Dew.name: Celestial Dew
Celestial Dew.summary: Carry out Absolution at the Church of Vows
description: A hidden Tear found in the Eternal City.
Also known as a Night Tear.
Allows one to carry out an Absolution at the Church of Vows, reversing all antagonizations.
Once upon a time, the stars of the night sky guided fate, and this is a recollection of those times.

Stonesword Key.name: Stonesword Key
Stonesword Key.summary: Use to break one imp statue seal
description: A sword-shaped stone key.
Breaks the seal on imp statues, but remains embedded in the statue after use, meaning it can only be used once as an item.
Think well before using one.

Rusty Key.name: Rusty Key
Rusty Key.summary: Opens a locked door in Stormveil Castle
description: Rusted iron key.
Opens a locked door in Stormveil Castle.

Dectus Medallion (Left).name: Dectus Medallion (Left)
Dectus Medallion (Left).summary: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Dectus
description: Left half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree.
Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Dectus, connecting the Altus Plateau to Liurnia.
The right half is said to reside in Fort Faroth in the Dragonbarrow, far to the east.

Dectus Medallion (Right).name: Dectus Medallion (Right)
Dectus Medallion (Right).summary: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Dectus
description: Right half of a split medallion depicting the Erdtree.
Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Dectus, connecting the Altus Plateau to Liurnia.
The left half is said to reside in the coastal Fort Haight to the far west.

Rold Medallion.name: Rold Medallion
description: Conjoined split medallion depicting the Flame Peak.
Brandishing the medallion activates the Grand Lift of Rold, connecting Leyndell to the Mountaintops of the Giants.
The forge of the flame of ruin is said to be found upon their peaks, and it is here Melina wishes to travel in resuming your journey together.

Academy Glintstone Key.name: Academy Glintstone Key
Academy Glintstone Key.summary: Key to open the academy's two sealed gates
description: Key to the seals binding both gates to the Academy of Raya Lucaria.
Activates warp magic bound within the seals.
This glintstone key is still brand new, unused by anyone.

Carian Inverted Statue.name: Carian Inverted Statue
Carian Inverted Statue.summary: Key revealing the hidden form of Carian Study Hall
description: Statuette of a scholar, with ground and sky inverted.
Reveals the hidden form of the Carian Study Hall, which connects to the divine tower.
To unveil the secret, affix it to the pedestal of the celestial globe.

Dark Moon Ring.name: Dark Moon Ring
Dark Moon Ring.summary: Ring of Lunar Princess Ranni's cold oath
description: Ring depicting a leaden full moon. Symbolic of a cold oath, the ring is supposed to be given by Lunar Princess Ranni to her consort.
Ranni is an Empyrean, meaning her consort would by rights earn the title of lord.
A warning is engraved within; "Whoever thou mayest be, take not the ring from this place, the solitude beyond the night is better mine alone."

Fingerprint Grape.name: Fingerprint Grape
Fingerprint Grape.summary: Eyeball of the knight Vyke, inflamed yellow
description: Eyeball of the knight Vyke, inflamed yellow.
Seared with a repulsive fingerprint burn akin to those that marred his entire body.
If offered to the blind maiden, it will lead her to the source of the distant light, allowing her to become a Finger Maiden.

Tonic of Forgetfulness.name: Tonic of Forgetfulness
Tonic of Forgetfulness.summary: Tonic that banishes distress and bitter memories
description: Tonic in a small brass vial.
Banishes distress and bitter memories.
A gift bestowed by Rykard, sworn to blasphemy, to Lady Tanith, who unfortunately had no use for it. "My Lord, there could be no greater distress than to forget you."

Serpent's Amnion.name: Serpent's Amnion
Serpent's Amnion.summary: Amnion from a womb that bore unintended offspring
description: Amnion from the mother's womb which cradled the poor unwanted offspring of a repellant birthing ritual.
It will never dry out, remaining damp indefinitely.

Irina's Letter.name: Irina's Letter
Irina's Letter.summary: Letter addressed to the commander of Castle Morne
description: Letter given by Irina, addressed to her father, the commander of Castle Morne.
Gorgeous silken handkerchief, lightly stained with blood. Words can be made out within.

Drawing-Room Key.name: Drawing-Room Key
Drawing-Room Key.summary: Key to the Volcano Manor drawing room
description: Key to Volcano Manor's drawing room.
The door can be found in the westward corridor, upon the left hand side.

Rya's Necklace.name: Rya's Necklace
Rya's Necklace.summary: Rya's necklace, stolen by a blackguard
description: Necklace stolen from Rya by the blackguard.
Features a relief of a dignified looking woman from a foreign country.
It appears to hold great significance for Rya.

Amber Starlight.name: Amber Starlight
description: An ephemeral sliver that gives off a pale amber glow.
What remains of a passing flash of starlight.
If the stars command our fates, then amber-hued stars must command the fates of the gods. Such is the belief that inspired the use of these shards to prepare a most special draught.
Cannot be consumed by mere humans.

Seluvis's Introduction.name: Seluvis's Introduction
Seluvis's Introduction.summary: Letter of introduction addressed to Sellen
description: Scroll bearing a royal coat of arms.
A letter of introduction written by Preceptor Seluvis.
Addressed to a glintstone sorceress by the name of Sellen.
The contents of the scroll cannot be discerned.

Sellen's Primal Glintstone.name: Sellen's Primal Glintstone
description: Glintstone from within the sorceress Sellen's body.
Seemingly half-alive, blood vessels are visible within.
In essence, a primal glintstone is a sorcerer's soul. If transplanted into a compatible new body after their original body dies, the sorcerer will rise again.
"My apprentice, do you think it distasteful?"

Miniature Ranni.name: Miniature Ranni
description: A doll resembling Ranni the Witch.
From head to toe every detail is perfect.
The chilliness is gone, feeling now like an empty husk.
There is no response.

Godrick's Great Rune.name: Godrick's Great Rune
Godrick's Great Rune.summary: Godrick's Great Rune, devoid of any benediction
description: The Great Rune of the shardbearer Godrick, devoid of any benediction.
Seek the Divine Tower of Limgrave, which stands beyond the great bridge from Stormveil Castle.

Radahn's Great Rune.name: Radahn's Great Rune
Radahn's Great Rune.summary: Radahn's Great Rune, devoid of any benediction
description: The Great Rune of the shardbearer Radahn, devoid of any benediction.
Seek the Divine Tower of Caelid, which stands upon the precipice at the Dragonbarrow's shore.

Morgott's Great Rune.name: Morgott's Great Rune
Morgott's Great Rune.summary: Morgott's Great Rune, devoid of any benediction
description: The Great Rune of the shardbearer Morgott, devoid of any benediction.
Seek the Divine Tower of East Altus, which stands beyond the great bridge from Leyndell's eastern ward.

Rykard's Great Rune.name: Rykard's Great Rune
Rykard's Great Rune.summary: Rykard's Great Rune, devoid of any benediction
description: The Great Rune of the shardbearer Rykard, devoid of any benediction.
Seek the Divine Tower of West Altus, which stands upon the precipice at the coast southwest of Leyndell.

Mohg's Great Rune.name: Mohg's Great Rune
Mohg's Great Rune.summary: Mohg's Great Rune, devoid of any benediction
description: The Great Rune of the shardbearer Mohg, devoid of any benediction.
Seek the Divine Tower of East Altus, which stands beyond the great bridge from Leyndell's eastern ward.

Malenia's Great Rune.name: Malenia's Great Rune
Malenia's Great Rune.summary: Malenia's Great Rune, devoid of any benediction
description: The Great Rune of the shardbearer Malenia, devoid of any benediction.
Seek the Isolated Divine Tower, which stands beyond the lost great bridge.

Lord of Blood's Favor.name: Lord of Blood's Favor
Lord of Blood's Favor.summary: Bloodied white oath-cloth, dyed in a maiden's blood
description: Fully reddened oath-cloth, dyed in a maiden's blood.
The final trial is complete. Luminary Mohg is sure to welcome you into his service, as a knight who will lay the foundations for his dynasty.

Spirit Calling Bell.name: Spirit Calling Bell
Spirit Calling Bell.summary: Bell that summons various spirits from ashen items
description: A bell capable of summoning various spirits
from ashen remains. It usually requires FP to use.
Spirits can only be summoned in the vicinity of a rebirth monument. When summoning is possible, the monument icon will be visible on the left side of the screen.
Only one type of spirit may be summoned at once, and none may be summoned during multiplayer.

Fingerslayer Blade.name: Fingerslayer Blade
Fingerslayer Blade.summary: Hidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron
description: The hidden treasure of the Eternal City of Nokron; a blade said to have been born of a corpse.
This blood-drenched fetish is proof of the high treason committed by the Eternal City and symbolizes its downfall.
Cannot be wielded by those without a fate, but is said to be able to harm the Greater Will and its vassals.

Sewing Needle.name: Sewing Needle
Sewing Needle.summary: Boc the demi-human's prized sewing needle
description: A large sewing needle, curved like a fang.
Boc the demi-human's prized possession.

Gold Sewing Needle.name: Gold Sewing Needle
Gold Sewing Needle.summary: Special sewing needle for demigod attire
description: Sewing needle made of gold.
Unique item made to alter demigod attire.
One of the tools brought by Radagon when he entered into marriage with Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, and joined the Carian line.

Tailoring Tools.name: Tailoring Tools
Tailoring Tools.summary: Enables armor adjustment at sites of grace
description: A portable set of tailoring tools.
Enables armor alterations at sites of grace.

Seluvis's Potion.name: Seluvis's Potion
Seluvis's Potion.summary: Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis
description: Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis containing a cloudy tonic of bluish black.
"Find Nepheli, and ensure she drinks it."

Amber Draught.name: Amber Draught
Amber Draught.summary: Glistening amber draught made for a scheme
description: Small flask received from Preceptor Seluvis containing a gleaming amber draught for use in a scheme.
"Give it to Ranni and ensure she drinks it. And we'll be in a position to claim the very finest puppet ever crafted."

Dancer's Castanets.name: Dancer's Castanets
Dancer's Castanets.summary: Castanets used by dancers from distant lands
description: Castanets used by dancers from foreign lands. Received from Patches.
The passionate dance comprises no seductiveness, but merely a dignified beauty.

Sellian Sealbreaker.name: Sellian Sealbreaker
Sellian Sealbreaker.summary: Can release Master Lusat from his confinement
description: Glintstone key received from the sorceress Sellen.
Capable of breaking the seal that keeps Master Lusat confined.
Sellia, Town of Sorcery can be found in Caelid. This key was said to have been found in the possession of a Sellian sorcerer.

Chrysalids' Memento.name: Chrysalids' Memento
description: Memento left by the chrysalids sacrificed for grafting. A brooch wrapped in red velvet. Traces of blood are visible.
Faintly visible spirits try to convey something, but their voices cannot be heard.

Black Knifeprint.name: Black Knifeprint
Black Knifeprint.summary: Mark of the Night of the Black Knives ritual
description: On the Night of the Black Knives, someone stole a fragment of Death from Maliketh, the Black Blade, and imbued its power into the assassins' daggers.
This mark is evidence of the ritual, and hides the truth of the conspiracy.

Haligtree Secret Medallion (Left).name: Haligtree Secret Medallion (Left)
Haligtree Secret Medallion (Left).summary: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Rold
description: Left half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree.
Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path.
In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.

Haligtree Secret Medallion (Right).name: Haligtree Secret Medallion (Right)
Haligtree Secret Medallion (Right).summary: Join medallions to operate Grand Lift of Rold
description: Right half of a split medallion depicting the Haligtree.
Brandishing the medallion with both halves conjoined will activate the Grand Lift of Rold, granting access to a hidden path.
In other words, this secret medallion will guide the bearer to the land of Miquella's Haligtree.

Mending Rune of Perfect Order.name: Mending Rune of Perfect Order
Mending Rune of Perfect Order.summary: Can be used to mend the shattered Elden Ring
description: Rune discovered by the noble Goldmask.
Used to restore the fractured Elden Ring when brandished by the Elden Lord.
A rune of transcendental ideology which will attempt to perfect the Golden Order.
The current imperfection of the Golden Order, or instability of ideology, can be blamed upon the fickleness of the gods no better than men. That is the fly in the ointment.

Mending Rune of the Death-Prince.name: Mending Rune of the Death-Prince
Mending Rune of the Death-Prince.summary: Can be used to mend the shattered Elden Ring
description: Rune gestated by Fia, the Deathbed Companion.
Used to restore the fractured Elden Ring when brandished by the Elden Lord.
Formed of the two hallowbrand half-wheels combined, it will embed the principle of life within Death into Order.
The Golden Order was created by confining Destined Death. Thus, this new Order will be one of Death restored.

Mending Rune of the Fell Curse.name: Mending Rune of the Fell Curse
Mending Rune of the Fell Curse.summary: Can be used to mend the shattered Elden Ring
description: Loathsome rune gestated by the Dung Eater.
Used to restore the fractured Elden Ring when brandished by the Elden Lord.
The reviled curse will last eternally, and the world's children, grandchildren, and every generation hence, will be its pustules.
If Order is defiled entirely, defilement is defilement no more, and for every curse, a cursed blessing.

Larval Tear.name: Larval Tear
Larval Tear.summary: Material needed by Rennala to grant rebirth
description: Core of a creature of mimicry known as a silver tear.
As much a substance as it is a living organism.
Material required by the amber egg cradled by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon, to birth people anew.
Being born anew allows the reallocation of attributes boosted by leveling up.

Imbued Sword Key.name: Imbued Sword Key
Imbued Sword Key.summary: Unseals sending gate, but disappears upon use
description: Stone key shaped like a sword.
A special item, imbued with rich blue magic.
Breaks the seal on the imp statues guarding the sending gates enshrined in each belfry, but remains embedded in the statue after use, meaning it can only be used once as an item.
Think well before using one.

Golden Tailoring Tools.name: Golden Tailoring Tools
Golden Tailoring Tools.summary: Allows demigod garb alteration at sites of grace
description: Tailoring tools made from gold.
Tools brought with the red-haired Radagon when he married into the Carian line.
With these, even demigod attire can be altered at a site of grace.

Cursemark of Death.name: Cursemark of Death
Cursemark of Death.summary: Cursemark carved into Lunar Princess Ranni's discarded flesh
description: Cursemark carved into the discarded flesh of Ranni the Witch. Also known as the half-wheel wound of the centipede.
This cursemark was carved at the moment of Death of the first demigod, and should have taken the shape of a circle.
However, two demigods perished at the same time, breaking the cursemark into two half-wheels.
Ranni was the first of the demigods whose flesh perished, while the Prince of Death perished in soul alone.

Seedbed Curse.name: Seedbed Curse
Seedbed Curse.summary: Curse grown on a body defiled by the Dung Eater
description: Curse grown on a corpse killed and defiled by the Dung Eater.
A tender pox afflicted with omen horns.
The Dung Eater cultivates the seedbed curse on corpses.
By doing so he prevents dead souls returning to the Erdtree, leaving them forever cursed. One of the most loathsome things found in all the Lands Between.

The Stormhawk King.name: The Stormhawk King
The Stormhawk King.summary: Ashes of a hawk which heeds no summons
description: Ashes of a hawk revered by all others as sovereign back in the days when Stormveil's winds still raged like no other.
This ancient monarch is proud however, refusing to answer anyone's summons.

Unalloyed Gold Needle.name: Unalloyed Gold Needle
Unalloyed Gold Needle.summary: Repaired intricate needle of unalloyed gold
description: An intricately crafted needle of unalloyed gold. Once snapped in half, it has been repaired by Sage Gowry.
A ritual implement crafted to ward away the meddling of outer gods, it is thought capable of forestalling the incurable rotting sickness.
"Now, all you need do is deliver the needle to Millicent, convalescing in the church atop the cliff just beyond Sellia."

Sewer-Gaol Key.name: Sewer-Gaol Key
description: Filthy key received from the Dung Eater.
Unlocks sewer-gaol door said to lie beneath Leyndell, the Royal Capital.

Discarded Palace Key.name: Discarded Palace Key
Discarded Palace Key.summary: Key to treasure chest for Carian Princesses
description: A key discarded by Lunar Princess Ranni alongside her very flesh.
Opens a treasure chest passed down to Carian Princesses.
It is said to be found in the Grand Library of Raya Lucaria with her mother Rennala.

Alexander's Innards.name: Alexander's Innards
Alexander's Innards.summary: Keepsake of the warrior jar Alexander
description: A keepsake of the warrior jar Alexander.
Found at the core of the dead flesh that once filled the great jar.
The jars contain dregs inherited from those who came before. Thus are warriors passed from jar to jar, carrying dreams of greatness.

Crafting Kit.name: Crafting Kit
Crafting Kit.summary: Enables the practice of item crafting
description: Leather bag containing a pestle and mortar, small blade, and various other tools.
Enables item crafting from the main menu.
Provides both means to fight and means to survive.

Whetstone Knife.name: Whetstone Knife
Whetstone Knife.summary: Can add new battle arts and affinities to weapons
description: Whetstone with a cipher inscription, made to look like a small knifeblade.
Allows the use of ashes of war at a site of grace to bestow new battle arts and affinities to armaments as skills.
The battle arts and affinities will depend on the ashes of war used.

Map: Limgrave, West.name: Map: Limgrave, West
description: Map of the western region of Limgrave.
The demesne of Limgrave, far south of the Erdtree, is bordered to the northwest by the cliffs of Stormveil, and under its ever-clouded skies roll the great steppes of the pale lands.

Map: Weeping Peninsula.name: Map: Weeping Peninsula
description: Map of the Weeping Peninsula.
The peninsula, to Limgrave's south, is named for its unceasing rainfall, redolent of lament.

Map: Limgrave, East.name: Map: Limgrave, East
description: Map of the eastern region of Limgrave.
Other than the Mistwood which envelops the south, it is known for its lands which lead to Caelid, a path trod by many a soldier in the past.

Map: Liurnia, East.name: Map: Liurnia, East
description: Map of Liurnia's eastern region.
The majority of Liurnia, known for its vast forests and ever-present fog, is sinking into a lake. The eastern coast is home to a highroad running north and south.

Map: Liurnia, North.name: Map: Liurnia, North
description: Map of Liurnia's northern region.
The Academy of Raya Lucaria towers over the north, while at its base spreads the town built around it, now flooded. Two highroads end their journeys here.

Map: Liurnia, West.name: Map: Liurnia, West
description: Map of Liurnia's western region.
The majority of Liurnia, known for its vast forests and ever-present fog, is sinking into a lake. The western coast has always been closely associated with Carian royalty.

Map: Altus Plateau.name: Map: Altus Plateau
Map: Altus Plateau.summary: Map of Altus Plateau and environs
description: Map of Altus Plateau and environs.
The Altus Plateau, where the Erdtree's base can be found, contains the Royal Capital of Leyndell to the east, and Mt. Gelmir to the west. Scars from the Shattering remain apparent to this day.

Map: Leyndell, Royal Capital.name: Map: Leyndell, Royal Capital
Map: Leyndell, Royal Capital.summary: Map of Leyndell Capital and environs
description: Map of the Royal Capital of Leyndell and environs.
Leyndell, City of the Erdtree, is a metropolis enclosed by double ramparts. The inner wall remains unbreached to this day.

Map: Mt. Gelmir.name: Map: Mt. Gelmir
Map: Mt. Gelmir.summary: Map of Mt. Gelmir and environs
description: Map of Mt. Gelmir and environs.
Mt. Gelmir, which houses the Volcano Manor at its summit, is characterized by sheer cliffs and ominous skies. These qualities only became more pronounced after the Shattering.

Map: Caelid.name: Map: Caelid
description: Map of Caelid and environs.
Caelid, known as the locale of the last battle between General Radahn and Malenia, Blade of Miquella, is a vast land consummately marred by scarlet rot.

Map: Dragonbarrow.name: Map: Dragonbarrow
description: Map of Dragonbarrow and environs.
The dragons that escaped the scarlet rot made a nest of the plateau to Caelid's north. Thus it was named "Dragonbarrow," and none dare to enter.

Map: Mountaintops of the Giants, West.name: Map: Mountaintops of the Giants, West
Map: Mountaintops of the Giants, West.summary: Map of Western Mountaintops of the Giants
description: Map of Western Mountaintops of the Giants.
Marching ground during the War against the Giants. They carved winding paths in the cliff walls right up to the summit, leading to the untrodden snow-laden region beyond.

Map: Mountaintops of the Giants, East.name: Map: Mountaintops of the Giants, East
Map: Mountaintops of the Giants, East.summary: Map of Eastern Mountaintops of the Giants
description: Map of Eastern Mountaintops of the Giants.
The remote, desolate eastern summit is the highest point in all the Lands Between, overlooking even the Flame Peak to the south.

Map: Ainsel River.name: Map: Ainsel River
Map: Ainsel River.summary: Map of Ainsel River and environs
description: Map of Ainsel River and environs.
Two great rivers flow beneath the Lands Between, the Siofra and the Ainsel. This vast region is said to be the grave of civilizations that flourished before the Erdtree.

Map: Lake of Rot.name: Map: Lake of Rot
Map: Lake of Rot.summary: Map of Lake of Rot and environs
description: Map of Lake of Rot and environs.
A great lake of standing water downstream of the Ainsel River. It is said that the divine essence of an outer god is sealed away in this land.

Map: Siofra River.name: Map: Siofra River
Map: Siofra River.summary: Map of Siofra River and environs
description: Map of Siofra River and environs.
Two great rivers flow beneath the Lands Between, the Siofra and the Ainsel. This vast region is said to be the grave of civilizations that flourished before the Erdtree.

Map: Mohgwyn Palace.name: Map: Mohgwyn Palace
Map: Mohgwyn Palace.summary: Map of Mohgwyn Palace and environs
description: Map of Mohgwyn Palace and environs.

In the lightless depths lies the grave of an ancient civilization. It is here Mohg, the Lord of Blood, is building his palace, to be the seat of his coming dynasty named Mohgwyn. And whatever nightmares that may bring.

Map: Deeproot Depths.name: Map: Deeproot Depths
Map: Deeproot Depths.summary: Map of Deeproot Depths and environs
description: Map of Deeproot Depths and environs.
At the very depths of the Erdtree's majestic roots lies the source of the Ainsel and the Siofra rivers. Here too begins the network of Greattree roots that spread throughout the Lands Between.

Map: Consecrated Snowfield.name: Map: Consecrated Snowfield
Map: Consecrated Snowfield.summary: Map of Consecrated Snowfield and environs
description: Map of Consecrated Snowfield and environs.
The route through this land, crossed east to west by a frozen river, leads to Miquella's Haligtree. This is the path taken by those unchosen, though it is a trial all the same.

Iron Whetblade.name: Iron Whetblade
Iron Whetblade.summary: Grants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon
description: Iron whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
When applying an affinity using ashes of war, an additional affinity of heavy, keen, or quality can be chosen.

Red-Hot Whetblade.name: Red-Hot Whetblade
Red-Hot Whetblade.summary: Grants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon
description: Red-hot whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
When applying an affinity using physical or flame-type ashes of war, an additional affinity of fire or flame art can be chosen.

Sanctified Whetblade.name: Sanctified Whetblade
Sanctified Whetblade.summary: Grants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon
description: Sanctified whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
When applying an affinity using physical or golden-type ashes of war, an additional affinity of sacred or lightning can be chosen.

Glintstone Whetblade.name: Glintstone Whetblade
Glintstone Whetblade.summary: Grants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon
description: Glintstone whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
When applying an affinity using physical or magic-type ashes of war, an additional affinity of magic or frost can be chosen.

Black Whetblade.name: Black Whetblade
Black Whetblade.summary: Grants choice of affinity upgrade to weapon
description: Black whetblade with a cipher engraved. Can be used as a whetstone knife.
When applying an affinity using physical or occult-type ashes of war, an additional affinity of poison, blood, or occult can be chosen.

Valkyrie's Prosthesis.name: Valkyrie's Prosthesis
Valkyrie's Prosthesis.summary: Golden prosthesis used by the one-armed Valkyrie
description: Golden prosthesis once used by the one-armed valkyrie.
A masterwork of craftsmanship, with practice and skill it can be used as proficiently as a real arm.
When Maleigh Marais, Lord of the Shaded Castle, embraced this prosthesis, he claimed to feel the presence of his personal goddess.

Beast Eye.name: Beast Eye
Beast Eye.summary: Said to tremble when close to Deathroot
description: Claw-marked stone eye received from Gurranq, Beast Clergyman.
It is said to tremble when near Deathroot.
The murky violet iris writhes as if alive.
"I am not sated... Feed me more...Death..."

Weathered Dagger.name: Weathered Dagger
Weathered Dagger.summary: Dagger received from Fia, Deathbed Companion
description: Dagger received from Fia, the Deathbed Companion.
She wishes for it to be returned to its rightful owner.
It was once a special weapon of gold and silver intertwined, but is now worn down and marred by a black gash.

Cracked Pot.name: Cracked Pot
Cracked Pot.summary: Container required for crafting cracked pot items
description: This empty pot somehow mends itself when broken.
Essential vessel for crafting cracked pot items.
The materials and magics sealed within deploy their effects when the pot is thrown.

Ritual Pot.name: Ritual Pot
Ritual Pot.summary: Container required for crafting ritual pot items
description: This empty pot somehow mends itself when broken.
Special item with greater durability than a cracked pot.
Essential vessel for crafting ritual pot items.
The materials and magics sealed within deploy their effects when the pot is thrown.

Perfume Bottle.name: Perfume Bottle
Perfume Bottle.summary: Container required for crafting perfume items
description: Glass bottles used by perfumers. Used to seal various scent compounds.
Essential vessel for crafting perfume items.
The art of perfuming was once jealously guarded in the capital, but after the perfumers were drafted into service during the Shattering, the art became widely practiced throughout the Lands Between.

Memory Stone.name: Memory Stone
description: A black, lightly beguiling stone.
Prized by the sorcerers who produce them.
Increases memory slots.
Said to be a fragment of the black moon that once hung above the Eternal City.

Talisman Pouch.name: Talisman Pouch
description: Small, withered bag, knitted by hand. Bestowed upon the ruling lord, or those attempting to become lord, by the elderly Finger Reader.
Increases talisman equip slots.
As the voices of the Two Fingers, Finger Readers are said to live lives eternal, and one is even supposed to have served as a wetnurse to royalty.

Dragon Heart.name: Dragon Heart
Dragon Heart.summary: Gain power of the dragon at the Dragon Communion altar
description: Dragon heart seized by a dragon tracker.
Riddled with Gravel Stone, this grotesque organ continues to beat vivaciously.
An offering used in the Dragon Communion. Consume a dragon's heart at the altar to make its power yours.
While a terrible and savage-looking thing, the heart has a peculiar beauty to it.

Lost Ashes of War.name: Lost Ashes of War
Lost Ashes of War.summary: Used to duplicate Ashes of War
description: Empty ashes of war, devoid of any memories of battle.
Unable to apply any kind of affinity in their current state, but can be used by Smithing Master Hewg of the Roundtable Hold to recreate other ashes.
Thus does the copy pass into becoming the genuine article.

Great Rune of the Unborn.name: Great Rune of the Unborn
description: Amber egg clutched by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon.
Great Rune of unborn demigods.
Perfects those who have been born anew.
Children born anew by Rennala are all frail and short-lived. Imperfect beings, each and all.
